website_summaries.verdict: This unique set offers a variety of bottle shapes alongside helpful accessories.
pros: Bottles showcase designs of horses, butterflies, peace symbols, and more
Many customers were impressed by the family-friendly size of this set
Includes 6 bottles and a number of accessories
cons: One of the more expensive sand art kits when compared with similar models

customer_reviews.title: Still like I remembered. FUN for the family!
customer_reviews.text: Fun for the family. The kids loved it so much they finished all of the sand art projects in less than 30 minutes. I remember these from when I was younger, and I can tell you, I had just as much fun doing it with my kids now as I did back when I was a kid. Just remember it is sand, and the projects go by very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: J.Gross

customer_reviews.title: Son Loves It
customer_reviews.text: The kid bought it. The kid loves it. It has given my 8 y/o a great little hobby. He was disappointed that there wasn't very much gold/sparkly sand; only enough for one creation. My adult assessment of the product is that it's about what I would expect. The plastic bottles seem cheap to me, but my son likes them and they haven't broken, so I guess that's all I can ask. FYI - If you're a Pinterest-er, look up how to make your own colored "sand" at home using salt!
customer_reviews.author: PMP

customer_reviews.title: that is fun to play with get your hands dirty you don't have to go outside
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't nothing that I didn't like about it it was very neat and I like to play with it making design in the bottle it's kind of cool I haven't done that since I was a kid I'm a 45 year old woman but I still like to play with toys
customer_reviews.author: Judith blundell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great set, good selection of shapes. My grandson, age 6 loved it and had a wonderful time making them.
customer_reviews.author: paula howard

customer_reviews.title: Very good, but don't buy it because of the glitter
customer_reviews.text: Very good, but don't buy it because of the glitter, they give one tiny pack, and it doesn't even show up in the smallest one. Great sand art, just the glitter part was why I chose this one...so that was dissapointing
customer_reviews.author: AAAmom

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Both of our kids loved this set! They were very cute and easy to use. If you have a kid who loves arts/crafts, I would definitely recommend the sand art.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Smaller Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: Smaller containers than expected but there is plenty of sand to be used for each one.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Sand Art!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter received this as one of her Easter gifts. She loved it so much she did all of them before the end of the day. She was able to give them as gifts!!
customer_reviews.author: JenJen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and son loved it. . Need to get more.. it was a great family thing
customer_reviews.author: Alisha Meeks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I believe that my Grandchild will love this Christmas present!
customer_reviews.author: Grammy

customer_reviews.title: She enjoyed it. But as adult
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old was given this for a Christmas present because obviously my ex's family hates me. She enjoyed it. But as adult, I could see the lids didn't seal enough for sand to be kept in. So I hot glued the tops of each one. There was enough sand for all the bottles to be filled, barely. No room for spills. I had to scrape sand up to finish off the last bottle. As other reviews have said there is barely any glitter that comes with it. Overall, she enjoyed it for about an hour or so.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Chauvin

customer_reviews.title: More fun and less messy than I thought
customer_reviews.text: We received this as a Christmas present and I must admit that I was not that excited to get it out with my 5, 3, and almost 2 year old. I assumed that it would be really messy and not that entertaining. For my family it was the exact opposite. We poured the sand over our kitchen sink so we had very little mess. My kids loved the bottle designs, the colorful sand, and the easy to use funnel. It was also a good way to work on colors with my younger children. Overall very fun and cute.
customer_reviews.author: my3girls

customer_reviews.title: It's fun but there's not enough sand for all six bottles
customer_reviews.text: It's fun but there's not enough sand for all six bottles. Maybe there would be enough sand if the kids didn't spill some - but they're kids! That happens! We ended up scooping sand off of the table and pouring mixed colors into the tops of the last bottles but it still wasn't enough. Great project, just be forewarned you'll end up with five completed bottles.
customer_reviews.author: H. L. LUSK
